main event: A civilian reported observing an unidentified flying object over Cambridge, Massachusetts on May 26, 1964, lasting for about 3-4 seconds.
interesting points: The observer described the object as a very thin ellipsoid with a major to minor diameter ratio of approximately 3:1,The object was white and moved smoothly, without making noise or leaving a contrail,The observation took place in clear visibility conditions with cumulus clouds present,The witness was a trained satellite observer, adding credibility to the sighting,No photographs or physical evidence were reported.
witness description: civilian observer with experience in satellite tracking
